name: Grilled Cheese
description: A quick and easy, classic, crunchy, and gooey sandwich.
ingredients:
2 slices of bread 
 2 T mayonnaise (approximate) 
 1-2 slices American cheese
steps:
Preheat skillet over medium heat 
 Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on one side of each piece of bread 
 Assemble sandwich with cheese slice(s) in between the bread with the mayonnaise on the outside of the sandwich 
 Place the sandwich in the pan and flip when desired doneness has been reached (about 2 minutes) 
 Repeat on the other side 
 Remove from pan, cut, and enjoy!
notes: Enjoy with a bowl of Tomato Soup!

name: Tomato Soup
description: A classic comfort soup that pairs well with a grilled cheese sandwich
ingredients:
4 T unsalted butter
1/2 onion (cut in wedges)
28 oz canned tomatoes (whole or crushed)
1 1/2 c water or stock
salt to taste
steps:
Melt the butter over medium heat in a large sauce pan.
Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a simmer.
Cook uncovered about 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. Be sure to taste as you go and add salt if needed.
Blend the soup using an immersion or standing blender. (Use caution as the soup is HOT.)
Enjoy!
notes:
This recipe is inspired by inspiredtaste.net's recipe
Consider adding basil, rosemary, cream, and/or cheese for a different flavor and texture.

name: Potato Soup
description: Grandma's go-to veggie and chicken soup.
ingredients:
2 T oil or bacon grease (optional)
1-2 carrots (shredded or sliced)
1-2 celery stalks (sliced)
2-4 cloves garlic (minced)
1 small onion (diced)
6-8 russet potatoes(washed and cubed)
6-8 boneless, skinless chicken tenders*
2 T Italian seasoning
1 T Oregano
 2 t basil
3 t chicken bouillon
2-3 t beef bouillon
2 t salt
1 t pepper
steps:
Heat a dutch oven or large pot over medium-high heat. Add oil or fat if using; alternatively, you can add a few T of water for the vegetables to steam in.
Add the carrots, celery, and onion to the pot.
While the veggies steam, you can prepare your potatoes. 
As you prepare your potatoes, place the cubes in a large bowl of cold water to prevent browning.
When the veggies have softened, add the garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30-60 sec).
Carefully pour your water and potatoes into the pot and add the rest of the ingredients.
Bring to a boil, add chicken, then cover and simmer about 20 min.
When chicken has fully cooked, remove from the pot, cut into cubes, and return to the soup. If the chicken cubes are still raw, heat them until cooked thoroughly (no pink should be visible).
Remember to taste as you go and add salt, pepper, or other seasonings as needed.
Enjoy your soup!
notes:
Pre-preparing the veggies in bulk and freezing makes this recipe even faster! If you cook them this way, you can just add the frozen veggies straight into the pot and don't need to add any fat; they'll steam in their own juices, releasing lots of flavor. This comes out to 1/4 - 1/2 cup of each.
For the chicken, you can use any cut you like and can even cook from frozen.
You can use any stock additive you like; if you don't want to use bouillon, you can use pre-made stock.
This goes great with grilled cheese or corn bread.
Ideas to try: add corn, cheese, rosemary, green chilies, red pepper flakes, and/or sour cream to change it up.

name: Oatmeal
description: A warming and filling breakfast to start your day.
ingredients:
1/2 c rolled oats 
 2 T peanut butter 
 1/2 t vanilla extract 
 1/4-1/2 t cinnamon 
 1 t brown sugar 
 pinch salt 
 OPT 1 T flax seed 
 OPT 1 T wheat germ 
 OPT 1/2 banana mashed
steps:
Combine all ingredients except brown sugar, flax seed, and wheat germ (if using) 
 Add 3/4 -1 c water 
 Microwave 90 seconds 
 Add additional ingredients (if using). Stir until peanut butter is fully incorporated. 
 Allow to sit 1-2 minutes to thicken before enjoying
notes: Flax seed and wheat germ have cholesterol-lowering properties.

name: Guacamole
description: A creamy, chunky, delicious avocado concoction perfect for dipping, spreading, or topping!
ingredients:
2-3 fresh avocados* 
 2 T sour cream 
 1-2 T lemon or lime juice 
 salsa (to taste) 
  paprika (to taste) 
 garlic powder (to taste) 
 onion powder (to taste) 
 salt and pepper
steps:
Halve avocado and scoop out the green flesh into a medium sized bowl, discarding the pit 
 Add the rest of the ingredients, tasting as you go**
notes:
*To check avocados for freshness, gently squeeze the fruit. It should be soft with a little give. 
 **All measurements are approximate, experiment and find the combination you like best! You can try dividing the mashed avocado between bowls and adding more or less of each ingredient to see how each impacts the taste.

name: Knock-off Stroganoff
description: A warm dish of creamy noodles with ground beef, mushrooms, and egg noodles.
ingredients:
1-2 lb ground beef
2 T butter
2 cloves garlic (minced)
1 lg onion (diced)
8-16 oz mushrooms (sliced)
1/4 c flour
3 c beef broth*
1 t paprika
1 T dijon mustard
1 T worcestershire sauce
2 T ranch dressing seasoning (opt)
1/2 c sour cream
1 pkg egg noodles (cooked al dente)
steps:
Brown ground beef in large pot over medium-high heat.
Remove the meat from the pan and set aside.
Melt butter in the same pan and sautee the garlic, onion, and mushrooms.
Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir, cooking about 1 min.
Turn heat to low and slowly whisk in broth, dissolving the flour.
Simmer and thicken (5-10 min)
Add the remaining ingredients except the noodles and simmer about 5 minutes.
Serve over noodles and enjoy!
notes:
If you don't have beef broth, you can use bouillon as a substitute.
You can also add the noodles into the mixture if you prefer.

name: Spaghetti Sauce
description: A classic better-than-jarred meat and tomato sauce to impress and satisfy your guests.
ingredients:
1 pkg italian sausage (optional)
1-2 lb ground beef
4-6 cloves garlic (mined)
1 small onion (diced)
2 14.5 oz cans diced tomatoes
2 14.5 oz cans tomato sauce
2 6 oz cans tomato paste
1 T italian seasoning
1/2-1 T dried basil
2-3 bay leaves
1/2-1 c parmesan cheese (the stuff in the can is fine!)
2-4 T brown sugar
salt & pepper to taste
steps:
(Optional) Roll sausage into ~1.5 inch balls and sear in a dutch oven or large pan over medium high heat and set aside. They don't need to be cooked through.
Cook the ground beef in the same pan, adding the onions and garlic when nearly all the pink is gone.
Add in the tomatoes and seasonings. (The brown sugar helps to cut some of the acidity.)
Return the sausage to the sauce. (Pre-cooking it helps to prevent the sausage over-powering the flavors, but you could also brown it with the beef if you prefer.)
Bring the sauce to a boil, then lower to a simmer and cook for 30 min - 2 hours. The longer it sits, the more the flavors will meld. Be sure to stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Remove the bay leaves and serve over noodles.
notes:
Adding garlic in at the end will provide a more powerful flavor; try it both ways!
Try other herbs like rosemary or thyme for a different flavor profile.

name: Egg Drop Soup
ingredients:
4 c chicken broth
1/2 t garlic powder
1 t ginger powder
3 eggs
2 T corn starch
steps:
Heat broth to boiling after adding cornstarch and seasonings
when boiling, stir in whisked eggs
enjoy!
notes: Can be served with green onions
